title: Four homeless men dead in New York killing spree
text:
Police were called to Manhattan after four homeless men were found dead (Picture: Twitter/ CBS12)

Police in New York are investigating after four homeless men were found dead in Manhattan early this morning.

The New York Police Department said the men were killed in their sleep by an attacker who hit them with a metal object, according to the New York Times.

Lieutenant Thomas Antonetti said a fifth victim was taken to hospital with critical injuries.

He also confirmed that officers had arrested a 24-year-old man, who is being held in custody, and recovered a three foot long metal object, described as similar to a construction stud.

Police received a 911 call just before 2am about the assaults, which took place in Chinatown.

Police said a man was discovered with ‘severe trauma to the head’ on The Bowery and a second man, who was taken to hospital, was found shortly afterwards.

Three other victims, who all died, were found on Broadway and East Broadway.

Lt Antonetti said the police were working to identify those who had died.

Three other men were found on Broadway and East Broadway with fatal injuries, the spokeswoman said.

In January 2019, an estimated 3,588 people were living on the streets in the city.
